thread.title: Production milestone for Northern Star
thread.title_full: Production milestone for Northern Star | afr.com

author: Post to Linkedin
title: Production milestone for Northern Star
text:
Northern Star is Australia's second-largest ASX-listed gold producer behind Newcrest Mining. by Trevor Hoey Last week's trading update by gold producer Northern Star featured record production for the three months to June 30 of 152,447 ounces, bringing full-year production to 580,784 ounces, representing the upper end of management's full-year guidance which was in a range between 550,000 ounces and 600,000 ounces.
This reinforces Northern Star's position as Australia's second-largest ASX-listed gold producer behind Newcrest Mining. The group said all in sustaining costs for both the June quarter and 2014-15 were set to come in at the lower end of guidance which was in a range between $1050 and $1100.
Cost metrics are becoming increasingly important at a time when the gold price is looking more likely to trend lower. Reg Spencer from Canaccord revised lowered his medium- and long-term forecasts on Monday with projections between 2015 and 2018 being lowered by about 4 per cent.
However, having also reduced his AUD/US dollar forecasts, the impact for an Australian gold producer such as Northern Star isn't substantial. Over the next three years the most significant realignment of the Australian dollar gold price is in fiscal 2016 where Canaccord lowered its estimate from $1649 per ounce to $1582 per ounce.
To illustrate the significance of these changes on a company such as Northern Star, there is still a margin of about $500 per ounce based on an all in sustaining cost at the upper end of management's guidance.
It is worth noting UBS recently predicted a sub-70Â¢ Australian dollar over the next six months and a number of analysts have pitched their foreign exchange projections over the next three years at levels some 5 per cent lower than Canaccord.
With production in excess of Hartleys forecasts and costs coming in lower than expected the broker remained positive on the stock with an accumulate recommendation and 12-month price target of $2.45.
Trevor Hoey
